title: Why is it so hard to shop for sustainable fashion when you're plus size?
text:
By Rose Stokes

The most exciting and influential trend of the year hasn’t been a ‘return to glamour’, or a new skirt length; it’s been the tide-turn towards sustainable fashion. It’s a pivot that highlights The Great Plus-Size Revolution that has been occuring in fashion over the past few years, as Instagram’s body positivity movement spilled from our smartphone screens into the advertising campaigns of numerous high-profile brands including Michael Kors, Nike and Dolce and Gabanna. And yet, despite seemingly parallel progress in the movements for sustainability and diversity within the fashion industry, it seems the two missions are yet to collide.
